name: Robocopy
description: Use Robocopy to perform a copy action.
author: Jungerius IT

inputs.name: source
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source where files or folders will be copied from

inputs.name: destination
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: The destination where the files or folders will be copied to.

inputs.name: files
inputs.label: Files to copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the file or files to be copied. You can use wildcard characters (* or ?), if you want. If the File parameter is not specified, *.* is used as the default value. Multiple items separated by comma.

inputs.name: copySubDirs
inputs.label: Copy subdirectories (non empty)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Copies subdirectories. Note that this option excludes empty directories. (/s)

inputs.name: copySubDirsAll
inputs.label: Copy all subdirectories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Copies subdirectories. Note that this option includes empty directories. (/e)

inputs.name: purge
inputs.label: Purge destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Deletes destination files and directories that no longer exist in the source. (/purge)

inputs.name: move
inputs.label: Move files and directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Moves files and directories, and deletes them from the source after they are copied. (/move)

inputs.name: createtree
inputs.label: Create directory tree only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Creates a directory tree and zero-length files only. (/create)

inputs.name: excludeFiles
inputs.label: Exclude files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?). (/xf)

inputs.name: excludeDirs
inputs.label: Exclude directories
inputs.helpMarkDown: Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths. (/xd)

inputs.name: retries
inputs.label: Number of retries
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the number of retries on failed copies. The default value of N is 1,000,000 (one million retries). (/r:<N>)

inputs.name: copyOptions
inputs.label: Other Robocopy options
inputs.helpMarkDown: Robocopy accepts a few command line options (e.g. /S /E /Z).
